channel.title: Has anyone managed to run ToL on linux using Wine?
channel.description:
I have Wine 2.8 set to Windows 7/Windows 10, with these DLLs enabled: [screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/KBbT06p.jpg) ("natywna" = "native", "wbudowana" = "built-in").
I ran other games using Wine, such as Hearthstone and Shadowverse, but all that happens when I try to run ToL is a pink screen and a crash after about a minute. Game works fine on this PC on an actual Windows 7, for the record. [Screenfetch for reference](http://i.imgur.com/rR14VkR.jpg)

item.title: Has anyone managed to run ToL on linux using Wine?
item.dc:creator: eevee
item.description:
Not wine.

Virtual machine with gpu passthrough. Very resource consuming and not recomended for any machine not made for it. But it works.

Wine didn’t work tho for me, even tho I tried earlier. It was few patches before tho.

Also, welcome to polish linux community. Lmao.

Read full topic
item.source: Has anyone managed to run ToL on linux using Wine?

item.title: Has anyone managed to run ToL on linux using Wine?
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
Random, but btw, if you are a Mac or Linux user, type ?rank mac user or ?rank linux user to participate in Alpha later for those OS’.

Back to OP, I’ve seen people run it successfully, but some have hanging at the login screen for connecting to Steam. Wine is officially “unsupported”, so we can’t help much further but yeah I saw a few in Discord using it. @eevee I think uses it.?

Read full topic

I have Wine 2.8 set to Windows 7/Windows 10, with these DLLs enabled: screenshot (“natywna” = “native”, “wbudowana” = “built-in”).

I ran other games using Wine, such as Hearthstone and Shadowverse, but all that happens when I try to run ToL is a pink screen and a crash after about a minute.
Game works fine on this PC on an actual Windows 7, for the record.
